text: Greg Mackey (20 October 1961 - 24 September 2014) was an Australian professional rugby league player from 1980 until 1996. He played as a five- eighth, fullback, winger and centre. He also captained some of his teams. He played for the South Sydney Rabbitohs, Paris Ch√¢tillon XIII, the Illawarra Steelers, the Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs, the Warrington Wolves and Hull. Mackey was born in New South Wales. He was married to Amanda. They had three children: two sons, Kane and Tom, and a daughter, Ebony. In December 2011, he was told that he had bowel cancer. Mackey died from a heart attack on 24 September 2014 in Sydney, New South Wales. He was 52. ==References== ==Other websites== * Greg Mackey at the Rugby League Project Category:1961 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Disease-related deaths in New South Wales Category:Sportspeople from New South Wales
title: Greg Mackey
